channel.title: Our dear friend,
channel.description:
Hello, First of all, I'm posting behalf of Wales_00. Yes, I know I fucking quit, get off my back. I'm posting for a friend.
Our dear friend wales_00 has recently been diagnosed with lung cancer. Please, keep him in your prayers and wish him health. If you fucking curse him I'll kill you in your sleep. I wish you luck and health Wales_00.
God bless you.
Please, no flame in this thread. I wish to keep the peace.

item.title: Our dear friend,
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Well, I unfortunately cannot say that I know you on a personal level, however I do understand what you’re going through as my father is back in the hospital and my mother was in there a while back for cancer. I wish you luck and only the best of it. If I had a religion, I’d be praying for you.

Best of luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Our dear friend,
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

It’s good to see moderators cracking down on the jackassery in this thread. This guy’s done nothing to deserve it and he’s looking at a fight for his life, so I imagine that even the backwater ilk of this community could manage some respect despite their bitter, self-loathing natures.

That being said, you have a better chance of surviving this than you do a car accident.

And lots of people walk away from car accidents.

Read full topic

item.title: Our dear friend,
item.dc:creator: @King_Lingerz King Lingerz
item.description:
@King_Lingerz wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:35, topic:299854”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=396155.msg2943057#msg2943057 date=1252023840]
Casey, you’re an idiot.
[/quote]
I am not new to this whole ‘cheating scene’

I’ve been through countless fake deaths, sickness, etc. Unless valid proof is exerted, than it’s probably a grab at attention.

Obviously people like Silverlining or Saevion both have enough proof that they indeed pass on, but without so it’s fair game to believe it’s a lie.[/quote]

Only retards would fake their own death. :rolleyes: The ‘attention’ he’d gain would probably be replaced by hate, and the sympathy replaced by flame.

Though let’s not start a big debate over this.

Read full topic

item.title: Our dear friend,
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

[quote=“blakeman8192, post:32, topic:299854”]I’ve done some research. Before I say what I have discovered, I want to explain something. In these studies, they pick “surviving at least 5 years” as meaning 5+ years, which could be anywhere from 5 years to over 80 years (depending whether or not the patient was cured). But the chances are, if you last 5 years, you’ve been cured of the cancer almost entirely.

Here’s what I discovered, over 85% of patients that are diagnosed with surgically removable (non-SCLC) lung cancer that are under 30 years of age survive “past 5 years” (meaning they are probably completely cured). It seems that 5 years is considered the breaking point for whether or not the cancer is cured. Now, take that “under 30 years” and factor in that he is 16 - only slightly more than half that, and he has a very high (obviously much higher than 85% - I would estimate around 92.5% using simple ratios) chance of being cured and conquering the cancer.

The (other) good news is, SCLC is almost always diagnosed to long-term smokers, and being 16 years of age he could not have been smoking for long-term, if at all - meaning it is very unlikely that he has SCLC lung cancer.

Your situation looks great hang in there and keep us updated man. Don’t ever give up the fight![/quote]

I know it’s easy for us to pull out percentages and reassure you when we’re not the ones facing down the disease, but that doesn’t change the fact that we support you and wish you the best of luck in your battle!

Read full topic
